questions.question: Which of the following driving skills is/are affected by the use of alcohol and/or drugs?
questions.explanation: Alcohol and other drugs can negatively effect a number of skills needed for safe driving, including a driver's reaction time, coordination, alertness, and ability to concentrate.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerC: Right turns permitted on a red light.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. It is illegal to turn right at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: It is dangerous to follow a motorcycle too closely because:
questions.answerA: They do not follow the same rules as motor vehicles.
questions.answerB: A motorcycle can stop much faster than a standard vehicle.
questions.answerC: They brake more slowly than motor vehicles.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles can stop quickly and following them too closely endangers your life and that of the motorcyclist. If the motorcyclist makes a mistake, you need to have enough time and space to avoid a crash.

questions.question: It is permissible for anyone to wear a dual ear headset while driving.
questions.explanation: While driving in Illinois, it is illegal to use a headset, which is defined as any device, other than a hearing aid, that allows you to hear or receive electronic communications. The use of a single-sided headset or earpiece with a wireless/cellphone device is permitted. Motorcycle, motor-driven cycle, and moped operators may use intercom helmets that permit a driver and/or passengers to speak to one another.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of of an approaching traffic signal.

questions.question: Speeds should be reduced below the posted speed limit for which of the following reasons?
questions.answerA: The driver is driving in unfavorable weather conditions.
questions.answerB: The driver is approaching and crossing an intersection.
questions.explanation: Regardless of the posted speed limit, weather and traffic conditions may make it necessary to drive more slowly. A driver must take care to slow down when approaching and crossing an intersection, going around a curve, approaching the top of a hill, or traveling on a narrow and winding roadway. A driver must be aware that there may always be dangers present due to pedestrians, traffic, weather, mechanical problems, or road conditions.

questions.question: This sign tells you that:
questions.answerA: No turns are allowed on the road.
questions.answerC: There is a series of curves ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming winding road.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

questions.question: This white sign means:
questions.answerA: The railroad crossing is controlled. Continue at your regular speed.
questions.answerB: Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
questions.answerC: Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.
questions.explanation: When approaching a railroad crossing, you must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Let any trains pass before you proceed.

questions.question: Adjust your rearview and side mirrors:
questions.answerB: Whenever you need to use them.
questions.answerC: Before you get into the car.
questions.explanation: Your safety and the safety of other drivers and pedestrians depends a lot on what you do before driving. Before moving your vehicle, you should adjust your seat, adjust your mirrors, fasten your safety belt, and secure items in and on your vehicle. Do not wait until your vehicle is moving to adjust your mirrors.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Right turn on red light permitted with caution.
questions.answerC: All traffic must turn right at next intersection.
questions.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate the the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed.
questions.answerB: The road ahead winds in a series of turns or curves.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the roadway will be slippery when wet and they should reduce their speed accordingly.

questions.question: This yellow signs means:
questions.answerA: The road ahead has many curves.
questions.answerB: There is a sharp curve in the road ahead.
questions.answerC: The road ahead may be slippery.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead may be slippery when wet.

questions.question: The best way to avoid a dangerous situation while driving is to:
questions.answerA: Know what is happening around your vehicle.
questions.answerC: Always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.
questions.explanation: Always be aware of what is happening around your vehicle. Constantly observing your surroundings to the front, sides, and rear of your vehicle will help you see problems that may require you to change speed or roadway position.

questions.question: Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
questions.answerB: Cough syrups and cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
questions.explanation: A number of drugs can impair your ability to drive, including depressant medications like tranquilizers and sedatives; over-the-counter cough syrups, cold tablets, and allergy medications (which may contain impairing substances like alcohol, codeine, or antihistamines); and illegal drugs.

questions.question: If a tire blows out, you should:
questions.answerA: Apply the brake and hold it.
questions.answerB: Hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.
questions.explanation: If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, hold the steering wheel tightly and keep the vehicle going straight.You should slow down gradually, taking your foot off the gas pedal and using the brakes lightly. Do not stop on the road if at all possible. Pull off the road in a safe place.

questions.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down because the lane ends ahead.
questions.answerB: Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
questions.answerC: Change lanes and maintain your current speed.
questions.explanation: As you enter a work zone, signs and message boards will warn you of workers, slow-moving equipment, and/or closed lanes ahead. You should reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop.

questions.question: This red and white sign means you should:
questions.answerA: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.
questions.answerC: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.
questions.explanation: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

questions.question: If the front right wheel of a vehicle runs off the pavement, a driver should ease off the accelerator, allow the vehicle to slow down, and gently steer back onto the pavement.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle’s wheels drift off the pavement onto the shoulder, you should grip the wheel firmly, ease your foot off the gas pedal, and brake gently. After checking for traffic behind you, gently steer the vehicle back onto the pavement.

questions.question: If driving in fog, a driver should turn on the high beam headlights to increase their field of vision.
questions.explanation: While it is not advisable to drive in fog, if you must drive in foggy conditions, you should drive with the headlights set on dim or use fog lights.

questions.question: Alcohol is the single greatest common factor in fatal motor vehicle crashes.
questions.explanation: Alcohol is the number one killer on American roadways. Alcohol affects a person’s vision and slows their reaction time, so it takes longer to act in an emergency. Alcohol affects a person’s driving even if they are below the level of illegal intoxication.

questions.question: What does this road sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in or are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. Be aware of children when driving near a school zone and follow posted speed limits.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You can travel in either direction in this lane.
questions.answerC: You are approaching a divided highway.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a 35 mph speed zone after the curve ahead.
questions.answerB: Drive no slower than 35 mph around the upcoming curve.
questions.answerC: Approach the upcoming curve at a speed of 35 mph or slower.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. These signs may be accompanied by speed advisory plaques that indicate the speed with which you should proceed.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign marks the presence of a crosswalk. Be alert to any pedestrians that may be crossing the roadway.

questions.question: What is the only effective way to remove alcohol from the body?
questions.explanation: The only way to remove the effects of alcohol from the body is to let time pass. Eating, drinking coffee, or taking a shower will not speed up this process.

questions.question: In order to obtain court supervision for a traffic violation, a minor must appear in court with a parent/legal guardian and attend a traffic safety school.
questions.explanation: A driver under age 18 who is under court supervision for a traffic violation must appear in court with a parent or legal guardian and also must attend traffic safety school.

questions.question: This symbol is used for:
questions.explanation: A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

questions.question: At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if:
questions.answerA: You first come to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: You wait until the light changes.
questions.answerC: You are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
questions.explanation: If you are in a lane corresponding to a signal displaying a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow when the way is clear. This is true whether the arrow is displayed alone or together with another signal.

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing that has no warning signals (such as electric flashing lights or gates), a driver should slow down, look, and listen.
questions.explanation: If a railroad crossing has no warning devices or only a crossbuck sign, you should slow down, look in both directions of the track, and listen for a train or railroad equipment. Only proceed with caution across the tracks when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you:
questions.answerA: Are following a small passenger vehicle.
questions.answerB: Are being tailgated by another driver.
questions.answerC: Are driving more slowly than the posted speed limit.
questions.explanation: When being tailgated, create extra space in front of your vehicle and do not brake suddenly. Slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with the tailgater.

questions.question: This yellow warning sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching a school or school crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.
questions.explanation: This sign is placed on roads near schools to warn drivers to slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.

questions.question: An individual’s driving privileges may be suspended under which of the following conditions?
questions.answerA: Three reckless driving offenses in 12 months
questions.answerC: The individual is over the age of 21 and has been convicted of illegally transporting alcohol twice in 12 months.
questions.explanation: If you are over age 21, your license may be suspended for one year in the event that you are twice convicted within a one-year period of illegally transporting alcohol.

questions.question: If a driver is arrested and refuses to submit to testing, driving privileges will be suspended for only three months.
questions.explanation: If a driver refuses to submit to chemical testing, driving privileges will be suspended for one year. If a driver under age 21 refuses to submit to testing, their driving privileges will be suspended for 6 months.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching the end of a divided highway.
questions.answerB: You are approaching the beginning of a divided highway.
questions.answerC: The road will be slippery ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. Keep to the right of the median divider.

questions.question: After a train clears a crossing that has flashing signals, drivers may proceed only after the lights have stopped flashing and no second train is coming on another track.
questions.explanation: At a railroad crossing, a driver may proceed only after the gate is all the way up, the lights are no longer flashing, or the flagger has signaled traffic to proceed. A driver should visually check all the tracks for any additional oncoming trains or railroad equipment before proceeding.

questions.question: When you see this yellow sign, you should:
questions.answerB: Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.
questions.answerC: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
questions.explanation: A five-sided sign indicates that you are near a school. Be aware and stop if children are in the crosswalk.

questions.question: If moving with a stream of vehicles across a railroad track, it is safe to stop on the track for a short period of time.
questions.explanation: It is prohibited to stop, stand, or park on a railroad track. You should never cross railroad tracks unless there is room for your entire vehicle on the other side of tracks.

questions.question: An orange sign means drivers should be alert, adjust their speed, and be prepared to stop if necessary.
questions.explanation: Orange is used for warning signs generally used in construction or maintenance areas. These signs alert a driver to possible dangers ahead due to construction and maintenance projects. Drivers must slow down and proceed with caution when entering construction zones.

questions.question: If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should:
questions.answerA: Quickly turn before the truck or bus is able to.
questions.answerB: Wait until the truck or bus turns before you turn.
questions.answerC: Squeeze between the truck or bus and the curb.
questions.explanation: If you try to insert your vehicle between a turning truck or bus and a curb, you may suffer a serious crash. To avoid a collision, do not turn until the truck or bus has completed its turn.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: If a vehicle starts to skid on water, the driver should quickly apply the brakes.
questions.explanation: If a vehicle skids while hydroplaning, the driver should try to regain control of the vehicle. If that is not possible, the driver should release the accelerator and ride out the skid. The driver should not immediately apply the brakes.

questions.question: You must yield the right-of-way to an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights by:
questions.answerA: Driving as closely to the right edge of the road as possible and stopping.
questions.answerB: Moving into the right lane and driving slowly until it has passed.
questions.answerC: Stopping immediately, even if you are within an intersection.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights. Do this by driving to the right edge of the road and stopping, taking care not to stop in an intersection. You may move again after the emergency vehicle has passed.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a crossroad ahead.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be alert to crossing pedestrians.

questions.question: Drivers are not required to yield to pedestrians in a crosswalk.
questions.explanation: A driver must come to a complete stop and yield when a pedestrian is in a marked crosswalk. A driver must also yield to a pedestrian who is in an unmarked crosswalk on the driver’s side of the roadway when there are no traffic control signals.

questions.question: After making a proper stop and yielding to traffic or pedestrians within the intersection, it is permissible for drivers on a one-way street to turn left at a red light onto another one-way street that moves traffic to the left.
questions.explanation: It is permissible to make a left turn at a red light when turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street that has traffic moving to the left. Before turning, you must come to a complete stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: When following any vehicle at night, it is important to dim your headlights.
questions.explanation: Drivers should dim their headlights when following all vehicles, including motorcycles. Always dim your headlights when following a truck at night.

questions.question: It is legal for anyone to talk on the phone if using a hands-free device while driving, unless they are under age 19.
questions.explanation: Illinois law prohibits the use of handheld cellphones, texting, or using other electronic communications while operating a motor vehicle. Hands-free devices or Bluetooth technology is allowed for persons age 19 and older.

questions.question: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle:
questions.answerA: Helps you keep up with traffic.
questions.answerB: Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.
questions.answerC: Allows you to spot upcoming police officers.
questions.explanation: To avoid the need for last-minute braking or turning, consistently watch the road far ahead of your vehicle. By looking ahead and being ready to stop or change lanes if needed, you can drive more safely, save fuel, and help keep traffic moving at a steady pace.

questions.question: When driving under low-visibility conditions due to fog, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn on your high beam headlights.
questions.answerB: Slow down and use your low beam headlights.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed so you do not cause an accident.
questions.explanation: When driving in fog, you should slow down and use your low beam lights. If the fog is so dense that you cannot see, pull off the road and wait for the fog to clear.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws and must be obeyed. Where this sign is posted, making a right turn is prohibited.

questions.question: This white sign means you should not pass other vehicles:
questions.answerA: Until after you pass the sign.
questions.answerB: Unless it seems safe to do so.
questions.explanation: A white rectangular sign indicates that you must obey the stated rule. This sign means that drivers should not pass other vehicles for any reason.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: An eight-sided red sign means "stop."

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn of actual or possible hazards. The color orange is used for warning signs usually found in construction or maintenance areas.

questions.question: A driver whose license has been revoked as a result of DUI must meet several requirements, including an evaluation for alcohol and drug problems and paying a reinstatement fee, to regain their license.
questions.explanation: If you are convicted of a DUI, you must undergo an alcohol/drug evaluation, successfully complete a rehabilitation or alcohol/drug education program, have an administrative hearing with the Secretary of State, pay a reinstatement fee, and/or meet other requirements.

questions.question: When driving at night on a dimly lit street, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive slowly enough that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.
questions.answerB: Turn on your high beam headlights to better see the vehicles ahead of you.
questions.answerC: Keep the instrument panel lights bright to be more visible to other drivers.
questions.explanation: You should drive more slowly at night than during the day because it is not possible to see as far ahead at night. You should make sure that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.

questions.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. Warning signs may alert drivers to areas where animals, people, and vehicles are likely to cross traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A triangular yellow sign with black lettering indicates a no passing zone. It will appear on the left side of a two-way, two-lane roadway at the beginning of an area where prohibitive pavement markings are also used.

questions.question: When approaching an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
questions.answerA: Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians, then proceed.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red.
questions.explanation: A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. When arriving at an intersection with a flashing red light, you must come to a full stop and proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that you are leaving a separated one-way highway and will soon be driving on a two-way highway.

questions.question: Drivers may pass on a two-lane roadway marked with a single solid yellow line on their side of the centerline.
questions.explanation: When there is a solid and a broken yellow line separating two lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions, a driver may pass only when the broken yellow line is nearest to the driver’s lane.

questions.question: Drivers are always required to stop for a stopped school bus when driving on a two-lane road.
questions.explanation: Drivers are always required to stop for a stopped school bus when driving on a two-lane road, regardless of their direction of travel. You should exercise caution when driving near children.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn of actual or possible hazards. The color orange is used for warning signs usually found in construction or maintenance areas.

questions.question: A driver whose license has been revoked as a result of DUI must meet several requirements, including an evaluation for alcohol and drug problems and paying a reinstatement fee, to regain their license.
questions.explanation: If you are convicted of a DUI, you must undergo an alcohol/drug evaluation, successfully complete a rehabilitation or alcohol/drug education program, have an administrative hearing with the Secretary of State, pay a reinstatement fee, and/or meet other requirements.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that another road crosses the highway ahead.

questions.question: If your car becomes disabled while on the highway, you should:
questions.answerB: Park with all four wheels off the traveled highway, if possible.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle becomes disabled, you must (if possible) park with all four wheels off of the main-traveled portion of the road.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Sharp turn to the right ahead.
questions.answerB: Upcoming sharp left and right turns.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns the driver that there is an upcoming winding road. Speed should be adjusted appropriately.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws and must be obeyed. Where this sign is posted, making a right turn is prohibited.

questions.question: Drivers must yield to pedestrians in an unmarked crosswalk.
questions.explanation: A driver must yield to a pedestrian when a pedestrian is in an unmarked crosswalk on the driver’s side of the roadway and there are no traffic control signals.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Watch for traffic on your right.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. You cannot make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign is posted on one-way streets and other roadways where a driver is not allowed to enter. A driver may see this sign if attempting to enter an expressway ramp in the wrong direction.

questions.question: When you see this road sign, you should:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that a divided highway is beginning and cars should keep to the right.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be alert to crossing pedestrians.

questions.question: If a traffic light shows both a red light and a green arrow, a driver may not turn in the direction of the arrow until the red light has changed.
questions.explanation: After yielding the right-of-way to traffic within an intersection or crosswalk, a driver may go in the direction a green arrow is pointing, regardless of other lights present.

questions.question: The three-second rule helps the driver determine a safe following distance.
questions.explanation: In general, you should use the three-second rule to determine a safe following distance.

questions.question: Regardless of fault, a crash report must be filed by the driver of a vehicle if the crash involves death, bodily injury, or property damage of more than $1,500 (or more than $500 if a vehicle is uninsured).
questions.explanation: Regardless of fault, a crash report must be filed by the driver of a vehicle if the crash involves death, bodily injury, or property damage of more than $1,500. If any vehicle involved in the crash is uninsured, a report must be filed for $500 worth of damage or more.

questions.question: A broken yellow line between two lanes of traffic means:
questions.answerA: Both lanes of traffic are going in the same direction.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted when it's safe.
questions.explanation: Dashed yellow lines separate single lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. Passing is allowed when there is no oncoming traffic in the passing lane.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A triangular yellow sign with black lettering indicates a no passing zone. It will appear on the left side of a two-way, two-lane roadway at the beginning of an area where prohibitive pavement markings are also used.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a 35 mph speed zone after the curve ahead.
questions.answerB: Drive no slower than 35 mph around the upcoming curve.
questions.answerC: Approach the upcoming curve at a speed of 35 mph or slower.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. These signs may be accompanied by speed advisory plaques that indicate the speed with which you should proceed.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited.

questions.question: Work zone barriers, drums, cones, and signs are used to:
questions.answerA: Make drivers angry about slow traffic.
questions.answerC: Keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.
questions.explanation: Work zones on highways have become increasingly dangerous places for both workers and drivers. When approaching a work zone, watch for materials such as cones, barrels, signs, large vehicles, and workers in brightly colored vests to warn you and direct you.

questions.question: An individual’s driving privileges may be suspended under which of the following conditions?
questions.answerA: Three reckless driving offenses in 12 months
questions.answerC: The individual is over the age of 21 and has been convicted of illegally transporting alcohol twice in 12 months.
questions.explanation: If you are over age 21, your license may be suspended for one year in the event that you are twice convicted within a one-year period of illegally transporting alcohol.

questions.question: When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
questions.answerA: Stop, regardless of your direction of travel.
questions.answerB: Stop if you are driving in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Slow down and be prepared to stop.
questions.explanation: When approaching a school bus that is picking up or dropping off passengers, you must come to a complete stop before reaching the bus, regardless of your direction of travel.

questions.question: A driver who becomes stranded in blizzard conditions should remain in their vehicle.
questions.explanation: If you become stranded in winter weather, you should remain with your vehicle. Run the engine only for brief periods of time and open the window to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign is displayed on slow-moving vehicles.

questions.question: Large vehicles have blind spots that can extend up to 200 feet directly behind the vehicle.
questions.explanation: Large vehicles have blind spots that can extend up to 200 feet directly behind the vehicle. Do not tailgate a large vehicle as they will have no way of knowing that you are there.

questions.question: On a green arrow, you must:
questions.answerA: Yield to any vehicle, bicycle, or pedestrian in the intersection.
questions.answerB: Yield to pedestrians only in the intersection.
questions.explanation: A green arrow means "go." You must turn in the direction the arrow is pointing after you yield to any vehicles, bicycles, or pedestrians who are still in the intersection.

questions.question: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog:
questions.answerA: Only when the guide dog is leading the person across the street.
questions.answerC: Only if a crossing guard is present.
questions.explanation: Pedestrians who use guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed.
questions.answerB: The road ahead winds in a series of turns or curves.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the roadway will be slippery when wet and they should reduce their speed accordingly.

questions.question: Drivers turning left must yield to:
questions.explanation: Drivers turning left must yield to oncoming vehicles that are driving straight ahead. A turning driver may only proceed when they can safely turn without affecting oncoming traffic.

questions.question: A pentagon-shaped sign is a:
questions.answerC: School zone or school crossing sign.
questions.explanation: A five-sided sign is used to alert drivers to a school zone. Some pentagonal signs specifically indicate crosswalks within school zones where children or other pedestrians may be present.

questions.question: Water on the road can cause a vehicle to hydroplane. Your car may hydroplane at speeds as low as:
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning occurs when there is standing water on a roadway. At speeds up to 35 mph, most tires will channel water away from the tire. As your speed increases past 35 mph, tires cannot channel the water as well and your tires may start to lose contact with the road and ride over the water like a set of water skis.

questions.question: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should:
questions.answerA: Immediately enter the far-right traffic lane on the interstate and speed up to match the flow of traffic.
questions.answerB: Use the shoulder of the main road to get up to the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.
questions.explanation: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, speed up only after you have identified a gap in traffic. In general, you should be stopped while waiting for a gap to appear.

questions.question: If the roadway is wet or icy, you should:
questions.explanation: Because your tires will not grip the road under wet, snowy, or icy conditions as well as they will under dry conditions, you should slow down if the roadway is wet or icy.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid collisions and brake damage.

questions.question: This is the shape and color of a ____ sign.
questions.explanation: Downward-facing triangular signs mean drivers must yield. When approaching a yield sign, slow down to a speed that is reasonable for existing conditions and stop if necessary. If you must stop, do so at a marked stop line, if it exists.

questions.question: A parent or legal guardian may request that the driver license of a minor be cancelled at any time prior to age 18.
questions.explanation: A 16- or 17-year-old driver must have the written consent of a parent/legal guardian to obtain a driver license. The parent/legal guardian who gave initial consent may cancel the minor’s license at any time, for any reason, until the driver turns 18.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This warning sign tells drivers to be alert to an intersecting side road ahead.

questions.question: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead to load or unload children, you must:
questions.answerA: Come to a complete stop until all the children have left the bus.
questions.answerB: Come to a complete stop until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn.
questions.answerC: Change lanes, drive slowly, and pass the bus cautiously.
questions.explanation: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead with its lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must come to a complete stop and wait to proceed until the lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn. Even after the bus begins to move again, do not proceed until you are sure there are no children crossing the road ahead of you.

questions.question: This sign indicates that:
questions.answerA: There is a steep hill ahead.
questions.answerB: No trucks are allowed on the upcoming hill.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should slow down and be ready to control their speed and protect their brakes from damage.

questions.question: When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
questions.answerA: You must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
questions.answerB: You have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
questions.answerC: Pedestrians must wait for you to cross.
questions.explanation: When facing a green light, you must yield to pedestrians and vehicles already in the intersection. Drivers must yield to pedestrians when turning on a steady green signal.

questions.question: A "Merging lanes" sign means drivers should be prepared to change lanes or allow other traffic to come into their lane.
questions.explanation: A "Merging lanes" sign indicates that two lanes of traffic going the same direction will soon merge into one lane. Drivers should be ready to either change lanes or allow other traffic to merge into their lane.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Change in direction or narrowing of roadway.
questions.explanation: This sign warns a driver of a change in direction or a narrowing of the road. A driver may find several of these signs on the outside of a sharp curve or on approaches to a narrow bridge.

questions.question: When you are behind a motorcycle, you should:
questions.answerA: Be ready to use your horn.
questions.explanation: When following a motorcyclist, allow for at least a three- to four-second following distance. Motorcycles can stop quickly and following them too closely endangers your life and that of the motorcyclist. If the motorcyclist should fall, you need extra distance to avoid the rider. The chances of a fall are greatest on wet and icy roads, gravel roads, and metal surfaces such as bridges, gratings, and streetcar or railroad tracks.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Where this sign is posted, it is prohibited to make a right turn. It would be unsafe and unlawful to make a right turn at an intersection with this sign.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Drive with caution and be ready to stop.
questions.answerB: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.explanation: The stop sign is the only eight-sided sign you will see on any roadway. When you encounter a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop. You may not proceed until the way is clear for you to completely and safely pass through the intersection.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane:
questions.answerA: The pedestrian must yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Honk your horn to let them know you are there.
questions.explanation: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian with a guide dog or a white cane.

questions.question: This sign indicates that the road ahead:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a reverse curve in which the road curves to the right, then to the left.

questions.question: When you drive through a construction zone, you should:
questions.answerC: Pass the construction zone carefully and not “rubberneck."
questions.explanation: To avoid contributing to chronic traffic congestion, you should not "rubberneck." That is, you should not slow down to look at out-of-the-ordinary things.

questions.question: It is illegal for persons under age 21 to drive with any trace of alcohol or drugs in their system.
questions.explanation: It is illegal for anyone to operate a motor vehicle on Illinois highways with any trace of a controlled drug, substance, or intoxicating compound in the blood. Drivers under age 21 will have their driving privileges suspended for three months if they are found to have had any trace of alcohol in their system after being stopped and issued a citation for a traffic violation.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

questions.question: You are driving on a one-way street. You may only turn left onto another one-way street if:
questions.answerA: You increase your speed before the turn.
questions.answerB: Traffic on the street moves to the right.
questions.answerC: Traffic on the street moves to the left.
questions.explanation: You may turn left onto a one-way street that moves to the left if there is no sign prohibiting the turn. You may not turn left onto a one-way street where traffic moves to the right.

questions.question: Where is it safe to pass another vehicle?
questions.answerA: Within an intersection where there are no oncoming vehicles
questions.answerB: Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing
questions.answerC: Within a curve where there are no oncoming vehicles
questions.explanation: Never pass within intersections or at other intersecting points, such as parking lot entrances and alleyways. Any time your view is blocked by a curve or a hill, you should stay in your lane and assume that there is an oncoming vehicle just out of sight. Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing other vehicles, you will have to determine whether or not you have enough space to pass in a safe manner.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You should stop for other traffic.
questions.answerB: Traffic is entering from another road and you should allow additional space for drivers to merge safely into the flow of traffic.
questions.answerC: Traffic is entering from another road and you should keep right.
questions.explanation: This sign alerts you to the possibility of traffic merging into the main stream of travel. After checking to your side and rear, you should move into another lane, if possible, to allow merging motorists a clear path.

questions.question: Children on bicycles should be given extra space by motor vehicle operators because:
questions.answerA: They do not have the same physical reflexes as adults.
questions.answerB: They are smaller and more difficult to see than adults.
questions.explanation: Children are often the least predictable pedestrians and the most difficult pedestrians to see. Take extra care to look out for children, especially near schools, bus stops, playgrounds, parks, and ice cream trucks. Be aware of children riding bikes on the sidewalk, as they may come onto the road unexpectedly.

questions.question: If it feels like your tires have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down by shifting into a lower gear.
questions.answerB: Ease your foot off the gas pedal.
questions.answerC: Slow down by pumping the brakes quickly and firmly.
questions.explanation: If it feels like your tires have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should ease your foot off the gas pedal and stay off the brakes. Do not try to stop or turn until your tires are gripping the road again.

questions.question: Drivers may open car doors on the side on which traffic is moving only when it can be done safely and without interfering with traffic.
questions.explanation: A driver or passenger may not open doors on the side of a vehicle on which traffic is moving unless it can be done safely and without interfering with traffic. The door may remain open only long enough to load or unload passengers.

questions.question: Before returning to your original lane after passing another vehicle, you should:
questions.answerB: See both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: When passing is permitted, look for both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror. Only then may you safely return to your original lane.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: The road ahead curves left then right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead curves right then left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the upcoming road will curve right, followed by a curve to the left. Drivers should adjust their speed to safely continue on the road.

questions.question: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should:
questions.explanation: To prevent hydroplaning, lower your speed in response to wet roads and keep your tires in good condition. If you detect a loss of control, take your foot off the gas, do not apply the brakes, maintain the direction of the vehicle, and allow the vehicle to slow to a manageable speed.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.explanation: A downward-facing triangular sign is always a yield sign. Drivers must be prepared to slow down or stop when approaching a yield sign.

questions.question: Cellphone use while driving is permitted as long as the driver is using a hands-free device and is over age 18.
questions.explanation: Illinois law prohibits the use of handheld cellphones, texting, or using other electronic communications while operating a motor vehicle. Hands-free devices or Bluetooth technology is allowed for persons age 19 and older.

questions.question: A driver does not need to allow as much distance when following a motorcycle as when following a car.
questions.explanation: In dry conditions, motorcycles can stop more quickly than cars. Therefore, a driver behind a motorcycle should allow at least three to four seconds of following distance so that the motorcyclist has time to maneuver in an emergency.

questions.question: This yellow sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a sharp turn to the right.
questions.answerC: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.
questions.explanation: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

questions.question: Slow vehicles should use the left-hand lane, except when passing or making a left turn.
questions.explanation: Slow vehicles must use the right-hand lane, except when passing or making a left turn.

questions.question: When following any vehicle at night, it is important to dim your headlights.
questions.explanation: Drivers should dim their headlights when following all vehicles, including motorcycles. Always dim your headlights when following a truck at night.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers?
questions.answerA: They know other drivers will do the right thing.
questions.answerB: They consider what other drivers might do and are prepared to react.
questions.answerC: They expect no breaks and give none.
questions.explanation: Driving defensively means anticipating potential errors made by others and preparing to compensate for their mistakes.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited. You may see a sign like this at an intersection that commonly has oncoming traffic.

questions.question: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:
questions.answerA: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.
questions.answerB: Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.
questions.answerC: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.
questions.explanation: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars in the right lane must slow down.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that there could be traffic merging from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you may not make a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a minimum blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of:
questions.explanation: For drivers age 21 or older, it is illegal to operate a motor vehicle with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of 0.08 percent or higher. Driving while under the influence of alcohol is not only illegal, but dangerous.

questions.question: After being pulled over by law enforcement, a driver should immediately exit the vehicle and quickly approach the officer’s squad car.
questions.explanation: If stopped by law enforcement, you should stay in your vehicle with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign informs drivers that they are leaving a divided roadway and approaching a two-way highway.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers that:
questions.answerA: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that the number of lanes is reduced ahead and that traffic should merge left.

questions.question: Blue traffic signs offer information on:
questions.answerC: Mileage information, such as distances to specific locations.
questions.explanation: Blue signs on the roadway are service signs. They are used to provide information about motorist services, such as upcoming rest areas, food options, or nearby hospitals.

questions.question: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards:
questions.answerC: Unless you do not see any children present.
questions.explanation: Drivers should be alert to the presence of crossing guards when near a school and must always obey their instructions.

questions.question: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?
questions.answerB: Right, toward the side of the road
questions.answerC: Left, toward the center of the road
questions.explanation: When parking facing downhill on a road with or without a curb, or when facing uphill on a road without a curb, turn your front wheels toward the edge of the road so your vehicle will roll away from traffic if the brakes fail. However, when parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn your wheels toward the center of the road so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

questions.question: When a train is approaching, all vehicles are required to stop within how many feet of the nearest rail of a railroad crossing?
questions.explanation: At a railroad crossing, you must stop within 15 to 50 feet if there is a posted stop sign, the electric signal is flashing, the crossing gate is lowered, a flagger issues a signal to stop, or a train is approaching and/or gives a warning.

questions.question: What is the penalty for being convicted of illegally passing a stopped school bus?
questions.answerA: Driving privilege or vehicle registration suspension and a minimum $150 fine.
questions.answerC: A $30 fine and 14-day suspension of driving privileges.
questions.explanation: A conviction for passing a stopped school bus with flashing lights and its stop arm extended will result in the suspension of an individual’s driver license. If the owner of the vehicle was not driving when the offense occurred, they must provide the State’s Attorney’s Office with the name of the person driving the vehicle or their vehicle registration will be suspended for three months.

questions.question: This white sign means:
questions.answerA: The railroad crossing is controlled. Continue at your regular speed.
questions.answerB: Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
questions.answerC: Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.
questions.explanation: When approaching a railroad crossing, you must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Let any trains pass before you proceed.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle:
questions.answerA: Pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
questions.answerB: Drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.
questions.answerC: Pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.
questions.explanation: When passing another vehicle that is traveling in the same direction as you, pass quickly to resume visibility. Return to your previous lane only when you can see both of the vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of of an approaching traffic signal.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: The road ahead winds with a series of turns or curves.
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers to be careful when driving under wet conditions as the pavement will become slippery and more difficult to navigate safely.

questions.question: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means:
questions.explanation: Slow-moving vehicles, such as farm tractors, road maintenance vehicles, and animal-drawn carts, display an orange and red triangle on the back.

questions.question: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:
questions.answerA: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.
questions.answerB: Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.
questions.explanation: When traffic permits, you should make room to allow vehicles to merge into your lane.

questions.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

questions.question: If you are getting tired while driving, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop and either get rest or change drivers.
questions.explanation: To avoid the dangers of fatigued driving, take breaks every hour or so during a long trip. If possible, share driving responsibilities with another person so you can each sleep while the other person drives.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: All roads are slippery and dangerous when wet. This sign warns of conditions that can cause a driver to lose control of a car. A driver should slow down when coming upon wet pavement because it takes longer to stop.

questions.question: If you are driving on a highway next to a single broken white line marking:
questions.answerA: You cannot cross the line to pass.
questions.answerB: You may cross the line to pass and change lanes.
questions.answerC: You may only cross the line to change lanes if you are in the left lane.
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. You may cross a dashed white line to pass or change lanes if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: A driver must slow down in a school zone:
questions.answerA: On school days between 7 a.m. and 4 p.m., when children are present, and where signs are posted.
questions.explanation: Drivers must reduce their speed to 20 mph in a school zone on school days between 7 a.m. and 4 p.m., when children are present, and where signs are posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A round sign always indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing.

questions.question: Make room for cars that are entering the freeway by:
questions.explanation: Make room for vehicles that are entering a freeway. If possible, merge into the next lane to create a gap for the incoming vehicles. If you cannot merge, adjust your speed to allow for the vehicles to enter traffic as smoothly and safely as possible.

questions.question: Which of the following are factors commonly contributing to traffic crashes?
questions.answerA: Exceeding the posted speed limit and driving too fast for conditions or circumstances.
questions.answerB: Getting adequate rest and staying alert.
questions.answerC: Scanning the environment and staying focused on the driving task.
questions.explanation: Driving above the speed limit, driving too far below the speed limit, and driving too fast for conditions are all actions that commonly contribute to traffic accidents. Always drive with the general flow of traffic, within legal speed limits.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that you are approaching a steep hill. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: It is permissible to make a right turn against a red signal light after stopping and yielding to other vehicles and pedestrians.
questions.explanation: A driver may make a right turn at a red light unless there is a sign prohibiting it. Before turning, they must come to a complete stop and yield to other drivers and to pedestrians.

questions.question: You should use your horn when:
questions.answerA: Another vehicle is in your way.
questions.answerB: It may help prevent a collision.
questions.explanation: Only use your horn when it is necessary to avoid collisions. Do not use your horn if a driver or bicyclist is moving slowly and you want him or her to drive faster or get out of your way.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your high beam headlights.
questions.explanation: You should use your low beam headlights when driving in fog. High beams will reflect back at the driver and lower visibility.

questions.question: If weather or light conditions require you to have your lights on while driving:
questions.explanation: Use your low beam headlights when driving in foggy, snowy, or rainy conditions. Light from high beam headlights will reflect back, causing glare and making it even more difficult to see ahead.

questions.question: Stopping distances and the severity of collisions:
questions.answerA: Decrease as a vehicle's speed increases.
questions.answerB: Are not affected by a vehicle's speed.
questions.answerC: Increase as a vehicle's speed increases.
questions.explanation: Excessive vehicle speed can have disastrous effects. As a vehicle's speed increases, the potential impact of a collision also increases, elevating the possibility of serious injury and death. Increase your following distance as your speed increases to ensure that you will be able to stop safely if needed.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a yield sign ahead. You should begin to slow down when you see this warning sign.

questions.question: If your car's suspension is bad, it can cause:
questions.explanation: Your suspension helps you control your vehicle and provides a comfortable ride over varying road surfaces. If your vehicle bounces a lot after driving over a bump, or is generally hard to control, you may need new suspension parts.

questions.question: Only vehicles displaying special plates or parking placards for persons with disabilities may park in spaces reserved for them by an official sign.
questions.explanation: A parking space marked by a "Reserved Parking for Persons with Disabilities" sign may only be used by vehicles that display Persons with Disabilities license plates, Disabled Veteran license plates, and/or disabled parking placards.

questions.question: Unless authorized to do so, drivers may not break into the line of a funeral procession.
questions.explanation: If you encounter a funeral procession, you must yield the right-of-way to all vehicles in the procession. You should not drive between vehicles in an organized funeral procession unless directed to do so by a law enforcement officer. It is illegal to join a funeral procession for the purpose of securing the right-of-way or attempting to pass any vehicle in an organized funeral procession, except where a passing lane has been specifically provided.

questions.question: If you are involved in or come upon a traffic crash, you should stop your vehicle in a safe, well-lighted public place that does not obstruct traffic, if able to do so.
questions.explanation: If you are involved in or come upon a traffic crash, you should stop your vehicle in a safe, well-lit public place that does not obstruct traffic (if possible); help any injured persons (if necessary or if they ask you to); call 911 immediately; warn other drivers by using emergency flashers or flares (if available); and ask everyone involved for their names, addresses, phone numbers, driver license numbers, and license plate numbers.

questions.question: Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a blood alcohol level of:
questions.explanation: There is zero tolerance for alcohol use by drivers under age 21. If you are under 21, the detection of any trace of alcohol in your system will result in stiff penalties, including the suspension of your license for two years.

questions.question: At a school crossing sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop, whether there is a stop sign or not.
questions.answerB: Watch for children and be ready to stop.
questions.answerC: Always sound your horn when you see children.
questions.explanation: Pentagonal signs mean you are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. When you see these signs, be alert and prepare to stop.

questions.question: When changing lanes, you should never:
questions.answerA: Cross the centerline in an intersection.
questions.answerB: Check your blind spots by looking over your left or right shoulder.
questions.answerC: Check for other drivers moving into the same lane.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, check for drivers trying to pass you who may be trying to enter the same lane as you. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot. You should never attempt to pass or otherwise change lanes in an intersection.

questions.question: What is the only effective way to remove alcohol from the body?
questions.explanation: The only way to remove the effects of alcohol from the body is to let time pass. Eating, drinking coffee, or taking a shower will not speed up this process.

questions.question: Your driving privileges will be suspended if you are convicted of illegally passing a stopped school bus.
questions.explanation: A conviction for passing a stopped school bus with flashing lights and its stop arm extended will result in the suspension of an individual’s driver license. If the owner of the vehicle was not driving when the offense occurred, they must provide the State’s Attorney’s Office with the name of the person driving the vehicle or their vehicle registration will be suspended for three months.

questions.question: What should drivers do when approaching a construction area?
questions.answerA: Increase their speed to get out of the way quickly.
questions.answerB: Slow down, stop all wireless telephone communications, and yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Honk their horn several times to alert individuals working in the area to their presence.
questions.explanation: When approaching a highway construction or maintenance area, Illinois law requires motorists to slow down, discontinue wireless/cellphone use (unless using a hands-free device), yield to any authorized vehicles or workers in the area, change to a lane away from the workers when possible, and proceed with caution.

questions.question: When entering traffic after being parked at a curb, you:
questions.answerA: Should drive more slowly than other traffic for 200 feet.
questions.answerB: Should wait for a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Should wait for the first two vehicles to pass, then drive into the lane.
questions.explanation: Any time that you merge into city or highway traffic, you should wait for a gap in traffic large enough for your vehicle to get up to the speed of other traffic.

questions.question: When waiting at an intersection and the traffic signal light turns green, a driver should look to the left and then right before proceeding into the intersection.
questions.explanation: Even after your light turns green, you must yield the right-of-way to other vehicles or pedestrians that may be in the intersection.

questions.question: Most rear-end collisions are caused by the vehicle in back following too closely.
questions.explanation: Following a vehicle too closely is the cause of most rear-end crashes.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A triangular red and white sign indicates that you must yield the right-of-way.

questions.question: If your car begins to skid out of control, you should:
questions.explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, stay off the brakes. Continue to correct your steering until the vehicle is back under your control and moving safely down the road.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A round yellow sign indicates that there is a railroad crossing ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a crossroad ahead.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drivers must bear either right or left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are arriving upon a fork in the road and they must bear either right or left.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. Where this sign is present, drivers must drive in the direction indicated by the arrow.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a steep downgrade is ahead on the road. Drivers should check their brakes.

questions.question: Signs with orange backgrounds are:
questions.explanation: The color orange is used only for construction and maintenance warning signs.

questions.question: When you see this black and yellow sign, it means:
questions.answerA: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only.
questions.answerB: There is a detour to the right due to road construction.
questions.answerC: The road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign tells drivers to slow down and prepare for an abrupt change in direction at an extreme angle.

questions.question: This white sign means you should not pass other vehicles:
questions.answerA: Until after you pass the sign.
questions.answerB: Unless it seems safe to do so.
questions.explanation: A white rectangular sign indicates that you must obey the stated rule. This sign means that drivers should not pass other vehicles for any reason.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Orange, diamond-shaped signs are used to mark construction, maintenance, survey, and utility work areas. These signs help direct drivers and pedestrians safely through dangerous zones. Fines for traffic convictions may double in areas marked by these signs.

questions.question: You should drive on the shoulder to pass a car:
questions.answerA: If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left.
questions.answerC: If the shoulder is wide enough.
questions.explanation: Passing on the right is permissible only if it is possible to do so without driving off the roadway. Never pass another vehicle on the shoulder because the other driver will not expect you to be there and may pull off the road.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming intersection so they may prepare for potential traffic or prepare to turn.

questions.question: Using a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
questions.answerA: It causes the driver to be concerned about the cost of the call.
questions.answerB: It occupies the driver's hands, eyes, and mind.
questions.answerC: It is an activity that draws the attention of other drivers.
questions.explanation: Using a cell phone while driving is dangerous because it occupies the user's eyes, hands, and mind. Even the most skilled drivers increase their risk of being involved in a crash by using a cell phone on the road.

questions.question: An orange sign means drivers should be alert, adjust their speed, and be prepared to stop if necessary.
questions.explanation: Orange is used for warning signs generally used in construction or maintenance areas. These signs alert a driver to possible dangers ahead due to construction and maintenance projects. Drivers must slow down and proceed with caution when entering construction zones.

questions.question: You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you should:
questions.answerA: Wait for signal lights to stop flashing.
questions.explanation: Even after a train passes, watch out for a second train approaching on any track. Do not proceed until all gates have been lifted and all warning signals have stopped flashing.

questions.question: A teen driver is allowed only two passengers under age 20 in the vehicle during the first 12 months of licensing.
questions.explanation: During the Initial Licensing Phase (for drivers ages 16 and 17), the number of a vehicle's passengers is limited to one person under age 20 for the first 12 months a driver has a license, unless the passenger(s) is/are a sibling, step-sibling, child, or stepchild of the driver.

questions.question: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:
questions.answerC: If it is prescribed by a physician.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely. This includes alcohol, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications, and illegal drugs.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should stop and:
questions.answerA: Check for vehicles only in the direction that you plan on going, then proceed.
questions.answerB: Let all vehicles that arrive before or after you go first.
questions.answerC: Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.
questions.explanation: At a stop sign, you must come to a full stop and check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you:
questions.answerA: Are approaching a railroad crossing and should prepare to stop.
questions.answerB: Will always stop at the upcoming railroad crossing.
questions.answerC: Should stop and wait for a signal before crossing the railroad tracks.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing. You must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Wait for any trains to pass before you proceed.

questions.question: When on a two-lane roadway, a driver must stop their vehicle when approaching a stopped school bus with its red warning lights flashing and stop signal arm extended.
questions.explanation: Unless the school bus is on the opposite side of a four-lane roadway, drivers are required to stop before overtaking a school bus that is loading or unloading passengers. A driver approaching a school bus from the opposite direction must come to a complete stop and remain stopped until the stop signal arm is no longer extended and the flashing lights are turned off, or the school bus driver signals vehicles to pass.

questions.question: If arrested with a blood-alcohol concentration of 0.08 percent or more, an individual's driving privileges will be suspended for at least six months.
questions.explanation: If a chemical test reveals a driver's blood alcohol concentration (BAC) to be 0.08 percent or higher, their driving privileges will be suspended for six months.

questions.question: What does this road sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in or are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. Be aware of children when driving near a school zone and follow posted speed limits.

questions.question: Temporary signs used in construction and maintenance work areas:
questions.answerA: Have a red background with green writing.
questions.answerB: Have an orange background with black writing.
questions.answerC: Have a yellow background with blue writing.
questions.explanation: All temporary signs in work zones have orange backgrounds with black writing and/or symbols.

questions.question: A driver may pass another vehicle by driving on the shoulder of the road.
questions.explanation: Drivers are not allowed to leave the pavement or main-traveled portion of the road to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign?
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "stop." You must always come to a complete stop at this sign.

questions.question: It is permissible for anyone to wear a dual ear headset while driving.
questions.explanation: While driving in Illinois, it is illegal to use a headset, which is defined as any device, other than a hearing aid, that allows you to hear or receive electronic communications. The use of a single-sided headset or earpiece with a wireless/cellphone device is permitted. Motorcycle, motor-driven cycle, and moped operators may use intercom helmets that permit a driver and/or passengers to speak to one another.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Right turn on red light permitted with caution.
questions.answerC: All traffic must turn right at next intersection.
questions.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate the the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle, a driver should wait until the entire car they've just passed is visible in the rearview mirror before changing back into the right-hand lane.
questions.explanation: When passing, you should not return to your original lane until the entire vehicle you've just passed is visible in your rearview mirror.

questions.question: When approaching a stop sign that is not marked by a crosswalk, drivers should stop their vehicles before entering the intersection.
questions.explanation: At a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the stop line, if there is one. If there is no stop line, you must make a complete stop before entering the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, you must stop before entering the intersection.

questions.question: Taillights are not required to be illuminated after dark.
questions.explanation: A vehicle's headlights must be on from sunset to sunrise. Vehicles must also have two red taillights visible for 500 feet from behind. Only one taillight is needed for mopeds and motorcycles.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign marks the presence of a crosswalk. Be alert to any pedestrians that may be crossing the roadway.

questions.question: When a motorist is turning right and a bicyclist is approaching on the right, the motorist should let the bicyclist go through the intersection before making their right turn.
questions.explanation: If you are turning right and a bicyclist is approaching on the right, you should let the bicyclist go through the intersection before making your turn.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. Warning signs may alert drivers to areas where animals, people, and vehicles are likely to cross traffic.

questions.question: A sign with this shape means:
questions.explanation: A diamond-shaped yellow sign warns of possible danger ahead. Orange signs, which are mostly diamond-shaped, are used to warn of possible dangers in or near work areas.

questions.question: When driving under snowy or icy conditions, it is safe to use your cruise control as long as your speed is reduced.
