questions.explanation: You should not use cruise control when driving on snowy or icy roads. Your tires may lose contact with the road and you will no longer have control of your vehicle.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This sign tells drivers that it is prohibited to make a U-turn.

questions.question: When you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights, you must:
questions.answerA: Maintain your speed and stay in your lane until the vehicle has passed.
questions.answerB: Move into the right lane and drive slowly until the vehicle has passed.
questions.answerC: Pull over to the curb or edge of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
questions.explanation: If you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights, pull over to the right edge of the road and stop. Position yourself parallel to the curb. On one-way streets, drive toward the road edge nearest you.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars on the right move first.
questions.answerC: Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.
questions.explanation: When approaching this sign, you must yield the right-of-way. Slow down and let vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path pass before you proceed. If necessary, stop before going ahead.

questions.question: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to:
questions.answerC: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.
questions.explanation: When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No left turn can be made here.
questions.answerB: A left turn can be made only after stopping.
questions.answerC: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection.
questions.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate that the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road may be slippery when wet. Exercise caution when driving on a slippery road.

questions.question: After making a proper stop and yielding to traffic or pedestrians within the intersection, it is permissible for drivers on a one-way street to turn left at a red light onto another one-way street that moves traffic to the left.
questions.explanation: It is permissible to make a left turn at a red light when turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street that has traffic moving to the left. Before turning, you must come to a complete stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must:
questions.answerA: Stay in the right lane as much as possible because the motorcycle is small and doesn't use all of the lane.
questions.answerB: Blow your horn to make the motorcycle move onto the shoulder so that you can pass.
questions.answerC: Have your vehicle entirely in the left lane before and during the pass.
questions.explanation: When passing a motorcycle, allow a full lane to the motorcycle. Never crowd into the same lane as the motorcycle. Returning to the original lane too soon can force a rider to swerve to the right and into traffic or off the road.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates the presence of a crosswalk, regardless of if it is marked on the pavement or not. Upon seeing this sign, you should be alert and allow any pedestrians to cross the road safely.

questions.question: How should a driver proceed if, while within an intersection waiting to make a left turn, the traffic signal light turns red?
questions.answerA: Wait in the intersection until the light turns green.
questions.answerB: Yield to oncoming traffic and complete the turn.
questions.answerC: Make sure it is clear, then back up from the intersection.
questions.explanation: If driver making a left turn enters an intersection while the light is green, they may finish the turn even after the light turns red.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that you are leaving a separated one-way highway and will soon be driving on a two-way highway.

questions.question: Headlights must be lighted from sunset to sunrise.
questions.explanation: Headlights must be turned on from sunset to sunrise.

questions.question: A driver must give the right or left turn signal when changing lanes.
questions.explanation: Drivers must use the appropriate direction turn signal when changing lanes.

questions.question: Illinois law requires that headlights be on when atmospheric conditions require the use of windshield wipers.
questions.explanation: Illinois law requires that you have your headlights on at any time when you are operating the windshield wipers.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see oncoming traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates parking spaces that are reserved for vehicles displaying Persons with Disabilities license plates, Disabled Veteran license plates, and/or disabled parking placards.

questions.question: In order to obtain court supervision for a traffic violation, a minor must appear in court with a parent/legal guardian and attend a traffic safety school.
questions.explanation: A driver under age 18 who is under court supervision for a traffic violation must appear in court with a parent or legal guardian and also must attend traffic safety school.

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing that has no warning signals (such as electric flashing lights or gates), a driver should slow down, look, and listen.
questions.explanation: If a railroad crossing has no warning devices or only a crossbuck sign, you should slow down, look in both directions of the track, and listen for a train or railroad equipment. Only proceed with caution across the tracks when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When driving at night, using only your parking lights is unlawful.
questions.explanation: It is unlawful to drive at night using only your parking lights. Drivers are required to use their headlights when driving in the dark.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign tells drivers to prepare to allow traffic to safely merge from the right.

questions.question: When an authorized vehicle using its sirens and flashing lights approaches a vehicle, the driver should pull to the right-hand edge of the roadway and wait for the emergency vehicle to pass.
questions.explanation: When being approached by an emergency vehicle that is using its lights and/or sirens, you must immediately pull to the right side of the road and allow it to pass.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign means drivers cannot make a left turn. It is unsafe and unlawful to make a left turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: If a vehicle is equipped with airbags:
questions.answerA: Seat belts should still be worn.
questions.answerB: Seat belts do not need to be worn.
questions.answerC: Seat belts should be worn behind the back.
questions.explanation: Airbags are important safety devices that provide protection in crashes. For best protection, a vehicle's lap and shoulder belts should be used in combination with airbags.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Watch for traffic merging from the right.
questions.explanation: Warning signs alert drivers to upcoming hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about potential traffic merging into their lane from the right.

questions.question: When experiencing a tire blowout, the driver should apply the brakes quickly and pull off the roadway to check the tire.
questions.explanation: If you experience a tire blowout, you should ease your foot off the gas pedal, keep a firm grasp on the steering wheel, pull safely off the roadway, and check the tires. You should not brake suddenly.

questions.question: When following a truck at night, it is important to dim your headlights.
questions.explanation: You should always dim headlights when following a truck at night. Bright lights will blind the drivers of large vehicles when they reflect off the large side mirrors.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Watch for people crossing your path.
questions.explanation: This orange warning sign tells drivers that an area of roadwork is upcoming. When traveling through a work zone, stay alert for temporary traffic control devices.

questions.question: When driving at night, you should:
questions.answerB: Look directly at the headlights of an oncoming vehicle.
questions.explanation: Driving at night is more hazardous than daytime driving because the lowered visibility makes it difficult to judge speed, distances, and other potential hazards. Increase your following distance to help prevent a potential collision if the vehicle in front of you should stop abruptly. Use your headlights when driving at night, following the rules for proper usage of high beams and low beams.

questions.question: Alcohol is the single greatest common factor in fatal motor vehicle crashes.
questions.explanation: Alcohol is the number one killer on American roadways. Alcohol affects a person’s vision and slows their reaction time, so it takes longer to act in an emergency. Alcohol affects a person’s driving even if they are below the level of illegal intoxication.

questions.question: When being passed by another vehicle:
questions.explanation: When being passed, you must yield to the passing vehicle and not increase your speed. Allow the vehicle to safely merge back into your lane.

questions.question: Driving privileges may be revoked for giving false information to the Secretary of State.
questions.explanation: You may be arrested, imprisoned for up to five years, or have your driving privileges suspended or revoked for 12 months if you sign a driver license/ID card application that includes false information.

questions.question: When approaching a four-way stop, drivers must yield the right-of-way to all motorists who arrived before them.
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, you must yield the right-of-way to drivers who arrived before you. Wait your turn to enter the intersection.

questions.question: Stopping distances and severity of crashes:
questions.answerB: Are not affected by vehicle speed.
questions.explanation: Stopping distances are longer and crashes are more severe when traffic travels at higher speeds.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a stop sign is ahead.

questions.question: This sign indicates:
questions.answerA: The distance from road surface to a bridge or overpass.
questions.answerB: The maximum legal height of a vehicle allowed in this state.
questions.answerC: The maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
questions.explanation: This is a low clearance warning sign. It indicates the distance from the road surface to the bottom of a bridge or overpass (in this case, 12 feet, 6 inches).

questions.question: If a driver is arrested and refuses to submit to testing, driving privileges will be suspended for only three months.
questions.explanation: If a driver refuses to submit to chemical testing, driving privileges will be suspended for one year. If a driver under age 21 refuses to submit to testing, their driving privileges will be suspended for 6 months.

questions.question: Motorcyclists are entitled to use the full width of a traffic lane. A driver should pass a motorcycle the same way a driver would pass another vehicle.
questions.explanation: Although there may be enough room in the traffic lane for an automobile and a motorcyclist, a vehicle driver should remember that the motorcyclist needs the room to maneuver safely and is entitled to the entire lane. A vehicle driver should not share the lane with motorcyclists.

questions.question: It is necessary to use your low beams any time you are:
questions.explanation: Use your low beams when driving in fog, snow, rain, or mist. Light from high beams will reflect off of precipitation, causing a glare and making it even more difficult to see. Some vehicles are equipped with fog lights that should be used in addition to low beam headlights.

questions.question: It is unlawful to:
questions.answerA: Pass another vehicle in any marked no passing zone.
questions.answerB: Pass another vehicle over a railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to cross the centerline to pass when driving on hills, in curves, and in other locations where you cannot see ahead far enough to pass safely. You may not pass at street crossings, at railroad crossings, where signs indicate no passing zones, or where a solid yellow line is next to your lane. You may not pass when the vehicle in front of you has stopped for a pedestrian or when driving in work zones where passing would be hazardous.

questions.question: This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
questions.explanation: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

questions.question: Check your rearview mirrors:
questions.answerA: Often to see how traffic is moving behind you.
questions.answerB: To see if a vehicle is in your blind spot.
questions.answerC: Only when you are slowing down.
questions.explanation: When driving, do not develop a fixed stare. Frequently check your rearview mirrors so you know the positions of vehicles near you.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that two lanes of traffic going the same direction will soon merge into one lane.

questions.question: This sign tells a driver that:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that there is a flag person ahead. Always follow directions given by a flagger. Flaggers normally wear orange or yellow vests, yellow-green shirts, or bright jackets. They use paddles and red flags to direct traffic through the work zone and to let workers or construction vehicles cross the road.

questions.question: If a vehicle starts to skid on water, the driver should quickly apply the brakes.
questions.explanation: If a vehicle skids while hydroplaning, the driver should try to regain control of the vehicle. If that is not possible, the driver should release the accelerator and ride out the skid. The driver should not immediately apply the brakes.

questions.question: Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
questions.answerA: Help you to be a better driver.
questions.explanation: Not getting enough sleep is a cause of poor driving behavior. Just like drugs and alcohol, sleepiness slows reaction time, decreases awareness, and impairs judgment.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Stop only if other cars are approaching.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. These signs alert drivers to areas where bicycles may be crossing.

questions.question: Which of these is a safe driving technique?
questions.answerA: Using your high beam lights in the fog.
questions.answerB: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.
questions.explanation: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

questions.question: Before stopping your vehicle at a traffic signal or sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Press down hard on the accelerator.
questions.answerB: Check your mirrors for surrounding traffic.
questions.explanation: When stopping your vehicle on the roadway, first check your mirrors for traffic. Be aware of surrounding drivers as you release the accelerator and allow your vehicle to slow. Move your foot to the brake pedal and press with steady pressure for a smooth stop.

questions.question: If oncoming headlights are blinding you while you are driving at night, you should:
questions.answerA: Look toward the right edge of the road.
questions.answerB: Switch your lights to high beams.
questions.answerC: Turn your lights on and off.
questions.explanation: If the headlights of an oncoming vehicle are blinding, glance toward the right edge of the road instead of looking directly ahead. This should keep your vehicle safely on the road until you pass the oncoming vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Slow down and do not use your brakes.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road ahead becomes slippery when wet.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: Last turn before a toll road.
questions.explanation: Orange is the standard color for work zone activity. If you see orange signs, cones, or barrels while driving, stay alert and be prepared for unexpected driving conditions. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming flagger whose directions should be obeyed by all drivers.

questions.question: Speeds should be reduced below the posted speed limit for which of the following reasons?
questions.answerA: The driver is driving in unfavorable weather conditions.
questions.answerB: The driver is approaching and crossing an intersection.
questions.explanation: Regardless of the posted speed limit, weather and traffic conditions may make it necessary to drive more slowly. A driver must take care to slow down when approaching and crossing an intersection, going around a curve, approaching the top of a hill, or traveling on a narrow and winding roadway. A driver must be aware that there may always be dangers present due to pedestrians, traffic, weather, mechanical problems, or road conditions.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that the roadway is slippery when wet.

questions.question: This red and white sign means you should:
questions.answerA: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.
questions.answerC: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.
questions.explanation: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

questions.question: This sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing that does not have a signal. You should:
questions.answerB: Proceed at a consistent speed while looking and listening for approaching trains.
questions.answerC: Slow down, look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby.
questions.explanation: At a railroad crossing marked with this sign, a driver should look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby. Never try to outdrive an oncoming train.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a pedestrian crosswalk.

questions.question: A broken yellow centerline means that:
questions.answerB: Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.answerC: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow centerline means that a driver may cross the centerline to pass another vehicle on the left as long as there is no oncoming traffic. Drivers should never cross a solid yellow centerline in order to pass.

questions.question: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation?
questions.answerA: Come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.
questions.answerB: If the intersection is clear, the driver does not need to stop.
questions.answerC: Drive quickly through the intersection to get out of the way of other vehicles.
questions.explanation: When traffic control signals are not working, a driver must always treat the intersection as an all-way stop and come to a complete stop, unless otherwise directed by law enforcement. The driver must then look and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

questions.question: For what distance should a continuous turn signal be given when making a left or right turn in a business or residential district?
questions.answerA: Not less than 50 feet before turning.
questions.answerB: Not less than 75 feet before turning.
questions.answerC: Not less than 100 feet before turning.
questions.explanation: In a business or residential area, a driver must give a continuous turn signal for at least 100 feet before turning. In other areas, the signal must be given at least 200 feet before turning.

questions.question: At a railroad crossing, you must:
questions.answerA: Watch for vehicles that must stop at all railroad crossings (school buses, trucks carrying hazardous materials, etc.).
questions.explanation: You must approach all railroad crossings with extreme caution and cross only when you know that no train is coming from either direction. Be aware of vehicles that must stop at all railroad crossings, such as school buses and trucks carrying hazardous materials.

questions.question: An orange-colored sign like this means:
questions.explanation: Orange-colored signs indicate construction areas. Proceed with caution.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is an intersection with a side road ahead.

questions.question: When a school bus is stopped ahead on your side of the road with its red lights flashing, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow to a speed no faster than 10 mph.
questions.answerB: Stop until the lights stop flashing.
questions.explanation: The flashing overhead lights and stop arm on a school bus will be activated when the bus is stopped to load or unload students. If approaching a bus using these signals, you may not proceed until the red lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm has been retracted. Never pass a school bus that is dropping off or picking up students.

questions.question: This yellow warning sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching a school or school crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.
questions.explanation: This sign is placed on roads near schools to warn drivers to slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the right lane ends ahead. A merging maneuver will be required for drivers in that lane.

questions.question: When turning left at an intersection:
questions.answerA: You should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
questions.answerB: Oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
questions.answerC: You should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
questions.explanation: Drivers making left turns must yield to oncoming traffic that is traveling straight. Drivers must always yield to pedestrians.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: What message will be found on this yellow pennant-shaped sign?
questions.explanation: Pennant-shaped yellow signs like this are used to indicate a no passing zone.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching the end of a divided highway.
questions.answerB: You are approaching the beginning of a divided highway.
questions.answerC: The road will be slippery ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. Keep to the right of the median divider.

questions.question: You hit a parked vehicle and can't find the owner. What must you do?
questions.answerA: Call your insurance company when you get home.
questions.answerB: Wait for the owner to return.
questions.answerC: Leave a note with your name and address on the parked vehicle.
questions.explanation: If you hit a parked vehicle or other property, you must leave a note with your name, phone number, and address securely attached to the vehicle or property that you hit.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: A road joins from the right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that the road ahead will turn sharply to the right and then sharply to the left.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street from the wrong direction.
questions.answerC: You may proceed if the way is clear.
questions.explanation: This sign marks a one-way road, entrance, or exit. If you are facing this sign, traffic is coming toward you. Turn around if you are driving toward this sign.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about driving speed is true?
questions.answerA: As your speed increases, the chance of a fatality increases.
questions.answerB: As your speed increases, so should your following distance.
questions.explanation: As driving speeds increase, the chance of a fatality in the case of a collision increases. If you are going faster than 80 miles per hour, you have almost no chance of living through a crash. The speed you drive affects your stopping distance, so you should increase your following distance as you increase your speed.

questions.question: A broken yellow line beside a solid yellow line indicates that:
questions.answerA: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid yellow line.
questions.answerB: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken yellow line.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that traffic in the lane next to the broken line may cross the line to pass, while traffic in the lane next to the solid line may not.

questions.question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
questions.answerA: Driving in both directions may pass.
questions.answerB: Next to the broken line may pass.
questions.answerC: Next to the solid line may pass.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken yellow line next to your driving lane means that you may pass.

questions.question: This sign indicates a:
questions.explanation: Yellow signs with black markings are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazards or special conditions. Round signs are used only to warn about upcoming railroad crossings.

questions.question: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?
questions.answerA: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.
questions.answerC: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
questions.explanation: Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to where pedestrians may be crossing. If a pedestrian is crossing in a crosswalk marked with this sign, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the pedestrian is no longer in the crosswalk.

questions.question: This yellow signs means:
questions.answerA: The road ahead has many curves.
questions.answerB: There is a sharp curve in the road ahead.
questions.answerC: The road ahead may be slippery.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead may be slippery when wet.

questions.question: Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
questions.answerA: Check your blind spots and mirrors.
questions.answerB: Signal your intention before changing lanes.
questions.explanation: Every time you want to change lanes or otherwise move your vehicle to the right or left, signal to alert other drivers to your intentions. Always check your mirrors and turn your head to check your blind spot before attempting any lateral move.

questions.question: The road surface of a bridge may be dangerous in winter because it may remain icy after the rest of the roadway is clear.
questions.explanation: Bridges, overpasses, shaded spots, and curves may remain icy after the rest of a roadway is clear and dry.

questions.question: While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
questions.answerA: Illegal to either drink from or possess open containers of alcohol.
questions.answerB: Legal to drink alcohol if you're not driving.
questions.answerC: Legal to drink alcohol if you're driving but not drunk.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to operate a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol. Neither drivers nor passengers may possess an open container of alcohol in a motor vehicle while it is in operation.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?
questions.answerA: If you can walk in a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive.
questions.answerB: If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn't impaired.
questions.answerC: Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed to drive safely.
questions.explanation: Being under the influence of alcohol affects your judgment. Good judgement is necessary to react appropriately to things that you see or hear while on the road. Even if you are below the legal blood alcohol limit, consuming any amount of alcohol is likely to affect your ability to drive safely.

questions.question: If moving with a stream of vehicles across a railroad track, it is safe to stop on the track for a short period of time.
questions.explanation: It is prohibited to stop, stand, or park on a railroad track. You should never cross railroad tracks unless there is room for your entire vehicle on the other side of tracks.

questions.question: When completing an emergency roadside stop, it is not necessary to put on your parking brake.
questions.explanation: Set your parking brake when making an emergency roadside stop. Turn on your emergency flashers to alert other drivers to your presence.

questions.question: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should:
questions.answerA: Proceed if you have the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Proceed if the pedestrian is not in your lane.
questions.answerC: Wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
questions.explanation: At a green light, you must give the right-of-way to any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian in the intersection. If a pedestrian begins crossing the street after the traffic signal light starts flashing, wait until they have crossed the street before proceeding.

questions.question: Yield also means stop if you cannot merge safely into the flow of traffic.
questions.explanation: In a situation requiring you to yield the right-of-way, you must also stop if you cannot merge safely into the flow of traffic.

questions.question: If the front right wheel of a vehicle runs off the pavement, a driver should ease off the accelerator, allow the vehicle to slow down, and gently steer back onto the pavement.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle’s wheels drift off the pavement onto the shoulder, you should grip the wheel firmly, ease your foot off the gas pedal, and brake gently. After checking for traffic behind you, gently steer the vehicle back onto the pavement.

questions.question: When passing a row of parked vehicles, you should:
questions.answerA: Be prepared for a person or vehicle to unexpectedly enter your lane.
questions.answerB: Expect all other drivers and pedestrians to respect your right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Drive closely to the parked vehicles to allow more room for moving traffic.
questions.explanation: Keep a space between your vehicle and parked vehicles. A person may step out of a parked vehicle or out from between the parked vehicles without looking. A driver may begin moving their vehicle before realizing you are there.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers about:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign is used to warn drivers about an upcoming curve to the right.

questions.question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
questions.answerA: Any lane (as long as it is safe).
questions.answerB: The lane closest to the left curb.
questions.answerC: The lane in the center of the road.
questions.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should begin the turn from the far left lane.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to the right lane ending and tells them to prepare for potential merging traffic.

questions.question: When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane:
questions.answerB: When you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
questions.answerC: When you can see the front of the vehicle in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: When passing another vehicle on its left, you may move back into the right lane when the headlights of the passed vehicle can be seen in your rearview mirror. Always signal before changing lanes.

questions.question: Your car must have a horn that can be heard from a distance of 200 feet.
questions.explanation: All vehicles must have a horn that can be heard from 200 feet away. Sirens, whistles, and bells are allowed only on authorized emergency vehicles.

questions.question: If driving in fog, a driver should turn on the high beam headlights to increase their field of vision.
questions.explanation: While it is not advisable to drive in fog, if you must drive in foggy conditions, you should drive with the headlights set on dim or use fog lights.

questions.question: Before a driver can regain driving privileges after losing them for failure to pay damages caused by a crash, the driver must file proof of financial responsibility with the Secretary of State’s office.
questions.explanation: Drivers without liability insurance who are at fault in a crash that results in injury, death, or property damage must provide a guarantee of payment to the Secretary of State's office. Failure to post this security may result in suspension of their license.

questions.question: In urban areas, drivers moving out of an alley, building, private road, or driveway do not need to come to a complete stop before entering the roadway if the roadway is clear of traffic.
questions.explanation: When emerging from an alley, building, private road, or driveway, a driver must come to a complete stop and yield the right-of-way to other drivers and to pedestrians.

questions.question: After a train clears a crossing that has flashing signals, drivers may proceed only after the lights have stopped flashing and no second train is coming on another track.
questions.explanation: At a railroad crossing, a driver may proceed only after the gate is all the way up, the lights are no longer flashing, or the flagger has signaled traffic to proceed. A driver should visually check all the tracks for any additional oncoming trains or railroad equipment before proceeding.

questions.question: "No passing zone" signs tell drivers:
questions.answerB: That it is not safe to pass.
questions.explanation: If you come across a "No passing zone" sign, it is not legal to pass in the indicated area. You are likely driving in an area with restricted visibility where it would be unsafe to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: While driving at night, a vehicle coming toward you has its high beams on, making it hard for you to see the road ahead. You should:
questions.answerA: Look ahead toward the left edge of your lane.
questions.answerB: Look ahead toward the right edge of your lane.
questions.answerC: Look straight ahead in your lane.
questions.explanation: If an oncoming driver fails to dim their high beams, you should avoid looking directly at the headlights. Instead, look toward the right edge of your lane and watch the oncoming vehicle out of the corner of your eye.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a winding road ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: An eight-sided red sign means "stop."

questions.question: You are preparing to exit the interstate. When should you start reducing your speed?
questions.answerA: About halfway through the deceleration lane.
questions.answerB: As you approach the deceleration lane.
questions.answerC: Immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.
questions.explanation: When leaving an interstate, you should maintain your speed until you enter the deceleration lane, at which point you should reduce your speed to the exit ramp's posted advisory speed.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a dangerous downgrade or hill ahead. The hill may be very long or steep, or it may have sharp curves.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that your current road ends at an intersection straight ahead. Slow down and prepare to yield or stop before turning right or left.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerC: Right turns permitted on a red light.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. It is illegal to turn right at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the road. To prevent hydroplaning in wet weather, you should:
questions.answerA: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
questions.answerC: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning is caused by driving too fast on a wet road. Slow down when driving on wet pavement to prevent hydroplaning.

questions.question: Drivers are not required to yield to pedestrians in a crosswalk.
questions.explanation: A driver must come to a complete stop and yield when a pedestrian is in a marked crosswalk. A driver must also yield to a pedestrian who is in an unmarked crosswalk on the driver’s side of the roadway when there are no traffic control signals.

questions.question: A railroad crossbuck sign should be treated the same as a yield sign.
questions.explanation: A railroad crossing crossbuck sign is considered a yield sign and a driver must yield the right-of-way to any oncoming trains and railroad equipment.

questions.question: It is permissible to pass on a two-lane two-way roadway within 100 feet of an intersection or railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: There are number of situations in which it is prohibited to pass on a two-lane two-way road. One of these is when you are within 100 feet of an intersection or railroad crossing.

questions.question: When approaching a disabled pedestrian using a guide dog, white cane, or other assistive device, a driver should yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: A pedestrian with a disability who is utilizing a guide dog, a white cane, a wheelchair, or another assistive device, whether on a sidewalk or roadway, has the right-of-way and is granted the same rights as any other pedestrian.

questions.question: A sign with this shape means:
questions.explanation: A pennant-shaped sign marks the beginning of a no passing zone.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Slow down and prepare to stop if cars are approaching you.
questions.answerB: Come to a full stop then proceed when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping.
questions.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see any oncoming traffic.

questions.question: Within how many feet is a driver required to dim their high beams before meeting another vehicle?
questions.explanation: Bright lights must be dimmed 500 feet before meeting an oncoming vehicle or 300 feet when approaching a vehicle from behind.

questions.question: This symbol is used for:
questions.explanation: A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

questions.question: Motorcycles, scooters, and mopeds are not easy to see; therefore, you should:
questions.answerC: Share a lane with a motorcycle.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles can be easily hidden in a vehicle’s blind spot or missed in a quick look due to their small size. Drivers of cars must always be alert and looking for motorcycles, mopeds, and scooters.

questions.question: It is legal for anyone to talk on the phone if using a hands-free device while driving, unless they are under age 19.
questions.explanation: Illinois law prohibits the use of handheld cellphones, texting, or using other electronic communications while operating a motor vehicle. Hands-free devices or Bluetooth technology is allowed for persons age 19 and older.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You can travel in either direction in this lane.
questions.answerC: You are approaching a divided highway.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic.

questions.question: When you see this yellow sign, you should:
questions.answerB: Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.
questions.answerC: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
questions.explanation: A five-sided sign indicates that you are near a school. Be aware and stop if children are in the crosswalk.

questions.question: When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) should:
questions.answerB: Press and hold the brake pedal firmly.
questions.answerC: Stay off the brakes and wait for the car to drift to a stop.
questions.explanation: When driving a vehicle equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS), a driver should press the brake pedal firmly when stopping on a snowy or icy surface. The ABS will pump the brakes more rapidly than a driver would be able to.

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
questions.answerA: Look for a train station ahead.
questions.answerC: Slow down and yield to trains.
questions.explanation: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

questions.question: If it is necessary to make an emergency stop while driving on an interstate, you should:
questions.answerA: Sound your horn at passing cars to get their attention.
questions.answerB: Get out of your vehicle and flag down the first vehicle that passes.
questions.answerC: Pull off the road, turn on your emergency flashers, and stay in your vehicle, if you can.
questions.explanation: If you must stop on the shoulder of the interstate or highway, turn on your emergency flashers to warn other drivers and stay inside your vehicle, if you can. The extremely high speed of traffic makes standing or walking along an interstate highway very dangerous.

questions.question: This sign tells you that:
questions.answerA: No turns are allowed on the road.
questions.answerC: There is a series of curves ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming winding road.

questions.question: This yellow sign means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of the possible presence of merging traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.explanation: A five-sided yellow or yellow-green sign alerts drivers to either a school zone or school crossing.
